origination.corpname: University of Michigan. Campus Broadcasting Network.

did.unittitle: Campus Broadcasting Network (University of Michigan) records 1953-1989
did.abstract: Campus radio broadcasting stations at the University of Michigan. Minutes of board of directors meetings, 1953-1989, general manager's files, and topical news files containing material concerning student protests, local Ann Arbor and state politics, and issues of concern to the students and administration of the University of Michigan; and printed material.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: This record group (donor no. 6542) was received in three acquisitions, 1980, 1987, 1993. Periodic accessions are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Campus Broadcasting Network (University of Michigan), Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Campus Broadcasting Network was founded in 1948 as a student-run "carrier-current" station serving the dormitory residents of the University of Michigan. Established as a non-commercial, educational free-form radio station, WCBN was both a local source of entertainment and news as well as a place where future broadcasters could receive training much like the Michigan Daily did for print journalists. During 1972-73, WCBN filed a petition with the Federal Communications Commission for an FM license that would allow the station to increase its power and thus add to its listening audience. With license approved, the station required more than seventy student volunteers to staff the radio station which then operated eighteen hours each day. In 1973, "WRCN" was established as the AM counterpart to WCBN. By 1976, the FM station WCBN, which was on-the-air twenty-four hours per day, seven days a week, had a staff of two hundred University of Michigan students and community members.

Providing broadcasting experience for students constitutes only one facet of WCBN-FM's operation. Known for its diverse programming, the station is a unique option for residents of the Ann Arbor community. In addition to news broadcasts, poetry readings, and other cultural and educational offerings, WCBN is virtually the only Michigan radio station to retain a "freeform" format. Avant garde and experimental, its musical repertoire spans the entire spectrum.

scopecontent.p: The records of the Campus Broadcasting Network fall into the following series: Organizational Files, Administrative Files, Financial Files, Personnel Files, General Manager's Topical Files, News Files, and Printed Materials.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Radio broadcasting--Michigan--Ann Arbor.
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. Campus Broadcasting Network.
University of Michigan--Students--Social life and customs--1951-1960.
University of Michigan--Students--Social life and customs--1961-1970.
University of Michigan--Students--Social life and customs--1971-1980.

scopecontent.p: The series of Organizational Files contains materials documenting the structure of CBN, the relationship between CBN and the university, its constitutions, goals and objectives, and policies and regulations.

did.unittitle: Relationship between WCBN and the University of Michigan

scopecontent.p: The Administrative series contains information on the governing bodies of the organization, arranged according to the hierarchical structure of CBN. The Board of Directors Minutes span the years 1953-1989, the election files from 1974 to 1978, the annual reports of the General Managers from 1958 to 1981, correspondence from 1971 to 1972, the minutes of the University Committee on Broadcasting from 1973 to 1979, and the Network and Inter-Quadrangle Council (IAC) Constitutions from 1958 to 1979.
The Financial Files contain financial information such as the 1974 Funding Study, Salary Account Statements from 1976-77, and Expenditures and Revenues of 1984.
The Personnel and Staff Files consist of the departmental goals of the non-student employees, Personnel Forms and Staff Surveys, the WCBN Master File from 1976-1978, and Staff Lists.

The series of General Manager's Topical Files consists of information regarding WCBN's position within the Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, and the radio broadcasting community, plus general correspondence and subjects relating to the actions of this organization. The files are arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Bernstein, Ralph: "The Relationship Between WCBN AM and FM" 1971
Floor Plan of Student Activities Building
Fraley, Jim: "A Position Paper on the Subject of News and Brief Examination of WCBN's Primary Sources of Information (i.e. UPI and ABC)" 1975
Questionnaire on objectives for student services
Report of the Commission to Study Student Governance 1974

scopecontent.p: Of particular importance are the News Files. A record of student interests and thought during the late 1960s to mid 1980s, the files may provide researchers with a perspective on events unavailable elsewhere. Anti-war protests, minority rights, environmental concerns, state and local politics, and University of Michigan departments and faculty are events and subjects of special interest to the student staff of WCBN.

scopecontent.p: The series Printed Materials contains publications and printed materials of WCBN and documents the varying activities that the radio station sponsored on the University of Michigan campus.

odd.p: (includes training manuals for WCBN and WJJX)
